intro: Pyrrocoma menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' pygmyweed, is a small, succulent plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many desert and semi-arid plants. The plant has fleshy, rounded leaves that are typically green or bluish-gray in color. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are often pink or purple. Pyrrocoma menziesii is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid environments.
